text: My dad left when I was 3 1/2, and he left my mom and I.
author: David Cassidy

text: My mom used to take me down to the Jersey Shore when I was 7, 8, 9 years old. I can remember being down in that area - Belmar, Seaside Heights, Asbury Park and all those places that I went back and revisited.
author: David Cassidy

text: Some of the best times I've spent in Colorado have been in the backcountry with my mom and siblings, and more recently, with my own kids. That is why I'm concerned to see today's kids spending more time browsing the Internet than exploring nature.
author: Mark Udall

text: I like my name. My mom named me after a song by the 1970s group Bread. So, it's meaningful, and I like the song. It's a love song - kind of - but it's kind of depressing and dark.
author: Aubrey Plaza

text: I want to go to college to study journalism. I want to speak French fluently, to travel. My mom was a journalist and it's in my blood.
author: Mandy Moore
